title: Are Carbon Offsets Slowing Real Emissions Cuts?
summary: A critical look at how voluntary carbon offset markets may be reducing pressure on corporations to cut direct emissions, based largely on analyst commentary and secondary reporting.

EVID.rationale: Mostly secondary sources; no primary audit data.

MECH.rationale: Offset accounting mechanism explained at surface level.

INC.rationale: Corporate incentive structure referenced but not quantified.

RISK.rationale: Risk framed qualitatively; no scenario modeling.

SPEC.rationale: Claims reference industry trends without specific companies or figures.

claims.text: Many large corporations are purchasing offsets instead of reducing operational emissions.
claims.notes: Based on industry trend reporting, no named entities.

claims.text: Carbon offset quality verification varies widely across registries.
